how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Choose a bronzing powder one to two shades darker than your skin tone..-Sweep bronzer over face where the sun naturally kisses, forehead, cheeks, chin, and neck, with a soft powder brush..-For a red-carpet bronze, create a ‚ÄòC‚Äô shape starting at the temples and finishing at the base of the cheekbones..-For a more sculpted look, use bronzer to contour along cheekbones, jawline.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I am super fair so I tend to have issues with bronzers being too dark or too orange for my skin-tone, but this bronzer has actually been really good for me! My skin is also very acne-prone, however, this product didn't cause me to breakout. My only complaint would be the smell, but that's due to personal preference. It's not an awful smell, I'm just not a fan of the fake chocolate smell. I haven't tried many bronzers because they're hard to find for someone as pale as me, but I'm glad I gave this one a shot.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had this bronzer years ago and the scent a little bit changed since then but the quality is on point. Before it smelled more chocolately now it reminds me cocoa but the scent is not overpowering. I am quite pale and have the lightest shade. Bealieve it looks very light inbut the packaging but it's very pigmented and little goes a long way. When you purchase you just have to figure out how much you really need to pick up with your brush and the result is beautiful. Doesn't transfer in an orange shade and has very natural finish but is buildable. I will definitely repurchase.
